The co', 'beginSection': 'abstract', 'endSection': 'abstract', 'document': 'http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/28323524'}, {'offsetInBeginSection': 0, 'offsetInEndSection': 734, 'text': 'The area under the receiver operating characteristic (ROC) curve (AUC) is commonly used for assessing the discriminative ability of prediction models even though the measure is criticized for being clinically irrelevant and lacking an intuitive interpretation.
